alert.note: Alert for Malibu Coast; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 19 at 9:53AM PST until November 19 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM SUNDAY FOR THE MOUNTAINS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES, SANTA CLARITA VALLEY, SAN FERNANDO VALLEY, AND VENTURA VALLEYS DUE TO GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITIES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM SATURDAY FOR THE VENTURA COUNTY COAST AND MALIBU DUE TO GUSTY SANTA ANA WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITIES... .Another moderate to locally strong Santa Ana wind event is underway this morning. Peak winds will continue through early this afternoon, with coasts and valleys gusting 35 to 55 mph (with local gusts to 65 mph in the foothills) and mountains gusting 40 to 60 mph (with local gusts to 70 mph for favored peaks and canyons). Humidity levels will generally range between 10 and 18 percent today through Sunday, with isolated readings down to 8 percent. Winds will slowly diminish tonight and Sunday morning, but will remain gusty in the mountains and wind prone valleys of Los Angeles and Ventura counties, with gusts in the 30 to 45 mph range during this time, likely maintaining critical Red Flag conditions in these areas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY NORTHEAST WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR VENTURA COUNTY COAST AND MALIBU ... * Winds...Northeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts peaking 35 to 50 mph diminishing to 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph by evening. Strongest winds through early afternoon. * Relative Humidity...Humidity levels lowering to 8 to 18 percent. * Impacts...If fire ignition occurs there could be rapid spread of wildfire that would lead to a threat to life and property.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are occurring. Use extreme caution with anything that can spark a wildfire. Residents near wildland interfaces should be prepared to evacuate if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information.
